JR0124026
Data Analyst, Fraud - Santa Ana, Costa Rica
Would you like to work where you can "think out of the box" and create clear recommendations on specific projects? Are you passionate about Risk and Fraud product development? Are you interested in joining a globally diverse organization where our unique contributions are recognized and celebrated, allowing each of us to thrive. Then, it’s time to join Western Union as a Data Analyst, Fraud.
Western Union powers your pursuit.
In this role, you will manage different data analyst requirements.
Role Responsibilities
- Collaborate with the Data Engineering Department to address data-related issues, create new databases for Risk reporting, and refine existing data structures.
- Develop and optimize SQL queries and Python scripts for data extraction and analysis.
- Manage and maintain the logics and fields used in reporting KPIs.
- Utilize Power BI to create and maintain dashboards and reports.
- Assist in the development and implementation of data management best practices.
Role Requirements
- Bachelor’s degree in engineering or data analytics. One year or less experience of database management, or similar roles.
- Experience in database SQL/Snowflake queries as user or, preferably, programming. Phyton is preferable.
- Advanced MSOffice skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
- Strong communication, presentation skills, self-organization and time management. Curiosity to learn and resolve different challenges and critical mindset to analyze the numbers or metrics.
- Upper Intermediate English Level.
- Experience with Kanban, and /or Safe. Experience with Wrike, SharePoint, Visio. Knowledge or experience in UX and API. Knowledge in project management tools like Jira, Confluence.

Our hybrid work model
Western Union values in-person collaboration, learning, and ideation whenever possible. We believe this creates value through common ways of working and supports the execution of enterprise objectives which will ultimately help us achieve our strategic goals. By connecting face-to-face, we are better able to learn from our peers, problem-solve together, and innovate.
Our Hybrid Work Model categorizes each role into one of three categories. Western Union has determined the category of this role to be Hybrid. This is defined as a flexible working arrangement that enables employees to divide their time between working from home and working from an office location. The expectation is to work from the office a minimum of three days a week.
